title: $\mu$SR study on noncentrosymmetric superconductor NbGe$_{\mathbf{2}}$
authors:
J. C. Jiao, K. W. Chen, A. D. Hillier, T. U. Ito, W. Higemoto, Z. Li,
  B. J. Lv, Z.-A. Xu, and L. Shu
abstract:
We report a muon spin relaxation ($\mu$SR) study on polycrystalline
noncentrosymmetric superconductor NbGe$_2$~with the superconducting transition
temperature $T_c=2.0\sim2.1$~K. Zero-field $\mu$SR~experiment indicates the
absence of spontaneous magnetic field in the superconducting state, showing the
preservation of time-reversal symmetry in the superconducting state.
Transverse-field $\mu$SR~experiment is performed to map the phase diagram of
NbGe$_2$, from which clear evidence of both type-I and type-II
superconductivity is obtained. More importantly, we clearly delineate the
region in the phase diagram where type-I and type-II superconductivity coexist.
